text: In the design manager, select the module you want to add, in the right sidebar, at the bottom, copy the snippet and paste it into the post body, save and reload the page, in the editor left sidebar you should see the module editable (you'll still see the snippet code in the post body but if you preview the page the code will be rendered correctly)
Hey all. Is there a way to set up a directory of custom modules and then have them be incorporated into a theme without copying the modules into the theme? Trying to centralize module development
I'm guessing it has to do with the "extends" section in theme.json?

<@U0336QCR2FQ> you'll want to use child themes probably: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/child-themes#:~:text=A%20child%20theme%20is%20a,Marketplace%20themes%2C%20and%20custom%20themes>.
Yeah that's what i'm using now, just wasn't sure if there's a way to tell the child theme to "grab modules from this path:" and it links to a centralized module
As it stands now we have to clone and move each module into each child theme
Unless it changed I think all parent modules will automatically be available in child themes
even though the actual files aren't there
they will still show up sync
and you can overwrite them by creating a module with the same name
(but I haven't used child themes in awhile)
Probably does make sense to version control it and just have a local directory of modules
